EXCLUSION IN FAVOUR OF DESCENDANTS
(1) A decedent's descendants as well as adoptive children and their descendants who have lived in the same household as the decedent and who have through their work, income or in any other way helped him or her with his or her gains, have the right to request that a part of the property, corresponding to their contribution to increasing or maintaining the value of the decedent's property, be excluded from the property and given to them.
(2) The portion thus excluded shall not be a part of the estate and shall not be included in the calculation of the statutory portion or the hereditary portion of the heir in question.
